data.name: Fibonacci Factory Function
data.description:
Create a factory function `genfib` that returns a function `fib` that always returns the next Fibonacci number on each invocation ( it should return `0` when being called the first time ).

Example:

<!-- Python reuses CS. Keep CS on top -->
```coffeescript
fib = genfib()
fib() # returns 0
fib() # returns 1
fib() # returns 1
fib() # returns 2
```
```javascript
const fib = genfib();
fib(); // returns 0
fib(); // returns 1
fib(); // returns 1
fib(); // returns 2
```
```haskell
do fib <- genfib
   fib -- returns 0
   fib -- returns 1
   fib -- returns 1
   fib -- returns 2
```
```lua
local fib = genfib()
fib() -- returns 0
fib() -- returns 1
fib() -- returns 1
fib() -- returns 2
```
